message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms of fever, sore throat, enlarged tonsils, tender cervical lymphadenopathy, and hematuria with proteinuria suggest acute glomerulonephritis. Among the options, only Diffuse Mesangial IgA deposition is associated with acute glomerulonephritis. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen causes Alport syndrome, C3 nephritic factor causes C3 glomerulopathy, and immune complex deposition causes post-infectious glomerulonephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest a glomerulonephritis. Among the options, only Diffuse mesangial IgA deposition is the most common type of glomerulonephritis associated with a recent upper respiratory tract infection. The other options are associated with other types of glomerulonephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest acute glomerulonephritis, which is most commonly associated with diffuse mesangial IgA deposition. The other options are associated with other types of glomerulonephritis but not consistent with this patient's presentation.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms suggest acute glomerulonephritis, which is most commonly caused by diffuse mesangial IgA deposition. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen, C3 nephritic factor, and immune complex deposition can also cause glomerulonephritis but are less common causes.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient's symptoms, including fever, sore throat, malaise, and pink urine with hematuria and proteinuria, suggest glomerulonephritis. Among the options, only Diffuse mesangial IgA deposition is associated with glomerulonephritis. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen is associated with Alport syndrome, while C3 nephritic factor and Immune complex deposition are associated with other types of glomerulonephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of dark urine with red cells and proteinuria suggests glomerulonephritis. The fever, sore throat, and malaise suggest an infectious cause, and among the options, Diffuse mesangial IgA deposition is the most common type of glomerulonephritis associated with an infection. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen cause Alport syndrome, while C3 nephritic factor causes complement-mediated glomerulopathy. Immune complex deposition can cause various types of glomerulonephritis but is less likely in this scenario.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest IgA nephropathy. Enlarged tonsils with tender anterior cervical lymphadenopathy suggest viral infection, which can trigger the disease. The urinalysis findings of pink urine with red blood cells and proteinuria are consistent with IgA nephropathy. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen, C3 nephritic factor, and immune complex deposition are all associated with other types of glomerulonephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest glomerulonephritis, and among the options, only Diffuse mesangial IgA deposition is a cause of IgA nephropathy, which is the most common form of glomerulonephritis worldwide. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen cause Alport syndrome, C3 nephritic factor causes alternative complement pathway-mediated hematuria, and immune complex deposition causes post-infectious glomerulonephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms suggest IgA nephropathy, which is characterized by hematuria and proteinuria following an upper respiratory tract infection. Inherited abnormalities in type IV collagen are associated with Alport syndrome, C3 nephritic factor with C3 glomerulopathy, and immune complex deposition with lupus nephritis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The symptoms, especially the enlarged tonsils and tender anterior cervical lymphadenopathy, suggest a recent infection. The presence of red cells and protein in the urine indicates renal involvement. IgA nephropathy, also known as Berger’s disease, is the most common cause of glomerulonephritis worldwide and is characterized by diffuse mesangial IgA deposition.
